Class Relation

    • siren.Relation

  • public class Relation
extends java.lang.Object
    Since:
    8/13/17
    Author:
    jonfreer

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String ABOUT
      Refers to a resource that is the subject of the link's context.
      static java.lang.String ALTERNATE
      Refers to a substitute for this context.
      static java.lang.String APPENDIX
      Refers to an appendix.
      static java.lang.String ARCHIVES
      Refers to a collection of records, documents, or other materials of historical interest.
      static java.lang.String AUTHOR
      Refers to the context's author.
      static java.lang.String BLOCKED_BY
      Identifies the entity that blocks access to a resource following receipt of a legal demand.
      static java.lang.String BOOKMARK
      Gives a permanent link to use for bookmarking purposes.
      static java.lang.String CANONICAL
      Designates the preferred version of a resource (the IRI and its contents).
      static java.lang.String CHAPTER
      Refers to a chapter in a collection of resources.
      static java.lang.String COLLECTION
      The target IRI points to a resource which represents the collection resource for the context IRI.
      static java.lang.String CONTENTS
      Refers to a table of contents.
      static java.lang.String CONVERTED_FROM
      The document linked to was later converted to the document that contains this link relation.
      static java.lang.String COPYRIGHT
      Refers to a copyright statement that applies to the link's context.
      static java.lang.String CREATE_FORM
      The target IRI points to a resource where a submission form can be obtained.
      static java.lang.String CURRENT
      Refers to a resource containing the most recent item(s) in a collection of resources.
      static java.lang.String DESCRIBED_BY
      Refers to a resource providing information about the link's context.
      static java.lang.String DESCRIBES
      The relationship A 'describes' B asserts that resource A provides a description of resource B.
      static java.lang.String DISCLOSURE
      Refers to a list of patent disclosures made with respect to material for which 'disclosure' relation is specified.
      static java.lang.String DNS_PREFETCH
      Used to indicate an origin that will be used to fetch required resources for the link context, and that the user agent ought to resolve as early as possible.
      static java.lang.String DUPLICATE
      Refers to a resource whose available representations are byte-for-byte identical with the corresponding representations of the context IRI.
      static java.lang.String EDIT
      Refers to a resource that can be used to edit the link's context.
      static java.lang.String EDIT_FORM
      The target IRI points to a resource where a submission form for editing associated resource can be obtained.
      static java.lang.String EDIT_MEDIA
      Refers to a resource that can be used to edit media associated with the link's context.
      static java.lang.String ENCLOSURE
      Identifies a related resource that is potentially large and might require special handling.
      static java.lang.String FIRST
      An IRI that refers to the furthest preceding resource in a series of resources.
      static java.lang.String GLOSSARY
      Refers to a glossary of terms.
      static java.lang.String HELP
      Refers to context-sensitive help.
      static java.lang.String HOSTS
      Refers to a resource hosted by the server indicated by the link context.
      static java.lang.String HUB
      Refers to a hub that enables registration for notification of updates to the context.
      static java.lang.String ICON
      Refers to an icon representing the link's context.
      static java.lang.String INDEX
      Refers to an index.
      static java.lang.String ITEM
      The target IRI points to a resource that is a member of the collection represented by the context IRI.
      static java.lang.String LAST
      An IRI that refers to the furthest following resource in a series of resources.
      static java.lang.String LATEST_VERSION
      Points to a resource containing the latest (e.g., current) version of the context.
      static java.lang.String LICENSE
      Refers to a license associated with this context.
      static java.lang.String LRDD
      Refers to further information about the link's context, expressed as a LRDD ("Link-based Resource Descriptor Document") resource.
      static java.lang.String MEMENTO
      The Target IRI points to a Memento, a fixed resource that will not change state anymore.
      static java.lang.String MONITOR
      Refers to a resource that can be used to monitor changes in an HTTP resource.
      static java.lang.String MONITOR_GROUP
      Refers to a resource that can be used to monitor changes in a specified group of HTTP resources.
      static java.lang.String NEXT
      Indicates that the link's context is a part of a series, and that the next in the series is the link target.
      static java.lang.String NEXT_ARCHIVE
      Refers to the immediately following archive resource.
      static java.lang.String NO_FOLLOW
      Indicates that the context’s original author or publisher does not endorse the link target.
      static java.lang.String NO_REFERRER
      Indicates that no referrer information is to be leaked when following the link.
      static java.lang.String ORIGINAL
      The Target IRI points to an Original Resource.
      static java.lang.String PAYMENT
      ndicates a resource where payment is accepted.
      static java.lang.String PINGBACK
      Gives the address of the pingback resource for the link context.
      static java.lang.String PRECONNECT
      Used to indicate an origin that will be used to fetch required resources for the link context.
      static java.lang.String PREDECESSOR_VERSION
      Points to a resource containing the predecessor version in the version history.
      static java.lang.String PREFETCH
      The prefetch link relation type is used to identify a resource that might be required by the next navigation from the link context, and that the user agent ought to fetch, such that the user agent can deliver a faster response once the resource is requested in the future.
      static java.lang.String PRELOAD
      Refers to a resource that should be loaded early in the processing of the link's context, without blocking rendering.
      static java.lang.String PRERENDER
      Used to identify a resource that might be required by the next navigation from the link context, and that the user agent ought to fetch and execute, such that the user agent can deliver a faster response once the resource is requested in the future.
      static java.lang.String PREV
      Indicates that the link's context is a part of a series, and that the previous in the series is the link target.
      static java.lang.String PREV_ARCHIVE
      Refers to the immediately preceding archive resource.
      static java.lang.String PREVIEW
      Refers to a resource that provides a preview of the link's context.
      static java.lang.String PREVIOUS
      Refers to the previous resource in an ordered series of resources.
      static java.lang.String PRIVACY_POLICY
      Refers to a privacy policy associated with the link's context.
      static java.lang.String PROFILE
      Identifying that a resource representation conforms to a certain profile, without affecting the non-profile semantics of the resource representation.
      static java.lang.String RELATED
      Identifies a related resource.
      static java.lang.String REPLIES
      Identifies a resource that is a reply to the context of the link.
      static java.lang.String RESTCONF
      Identifies the root of RESTCONF API as configured on this HTTP server.
      static java.lang.String SEARCH
      Refers to a resource that can be used to search through the link's context and related resources.
      static java.lang.String SECTION
      Refers to a section in a collection of resources.
      static java.lang.String SELF
      Conveys an identifier for the link's context.
      static java.lang.String SERVICE
      Indicates a URI that can be used to retrieve a service document.
      static java.lang.String START
      Refers to the first resource in a collection of resources.
      static java.lang.String STYLESHEET
      Refers to a stylesheet.
      static java.lang.String SUBSECTION
      Refers to a resource serving as a subsection in a collection of resources.
      static java.lang.String SUCCESSOR_VERSION
      Points to a resource containing the successor version in the version history.
      static java.lang.String TAG
      Gives a tag (identified by the given address) that applies to the current document.
      static java.lang.String TERMS_OF_SERVICE
      Refers to the terms of service associated with the link's context.
      static java.lang.String TIME_GATE
      The Target IRI points to a TimeGate for an Original Resource.
      static java.lang.String TIME_MAP
      The Target IRI points to a TimeMap for an Original Resource.
      static java.lang.String TYPE
      Refers to a resource identifying the abstract semantic type of which the link's context is considered to be an instance.
      static java.lang.String UP
      Refers to a parent document in a hierarchy of documents.
      static java.lang.String VERSION_HISTORY
      Points to a resource containing the version history for the context.
      static java.lang.String VIA
      Identifies a resource that is the source of the information in the link's context.
      static java.lang.String WEB_MENTION
      Identifies a target URI that supports the Webmention protcol.
      static java.lang.String WORKING_COPY
      Points to a working copy for this resource.
      static java.lang.String WORKING_COPY_OF
      Points to the versioned resource from which this working copy was obtained.

      • CONVERTED_FROM

        public static final java.lang.String CONVERTED_FROM
        The document linked to was later converted to the document that contains this link relation. For example, an RFC can have a link to the Internet-Draft that became the RFC; in that case, the link relation would be "convertedFrom".
        See Also:
        RFC7991, Constant Field Values

      • DESCRIBES

        public static final java.lang.String DESCRIBES
        The relationship A 'describes' B asserts that resource A provides a description of resource B. There are no constraints on the format or representation of either A or B, neither are there any further constraints on either resource.
        See Also:
        RFC6892, Constant Field Values

      • LRDD

        public static final java.lang.String LRDD
        Refers to further information about the link's context, expressed as a LRDD ("Link-based Resource Descriptor Document") resource. See [RFC6415] for information about processing this relation type in host-meta documents. When used elsewhere, it refers to additional links and other metadata. Multiple instances indicate additional LRDD resources. LRDD resources MUST have an "application/xrd+xml" representation, and MAY have others.
        See Also:
        RFC6415, Constant Field Values

      • MEMENTO

        public static final java.lang.String MEMENTO
        The Target IRI points to a Memento, a fixed resource that will not change state anymore.
        See Also:
        RFC7089, Constant Field Values

      • MONITOR

        public static final java.lang.String MONITOR
        Refers to a resource that can be used to monitor changes in an HTTP resource.
        See Also:
        RFC5989, Constant Field Values

      • MONITOR_GROUP

        public static final java.lang.String MONITOR_GROUP
        Refers to a resource that can be used to monitor changes in a specified group of HTTP resources.
        See Also:
        RFC5989, Constant Field Values

        public static final java.lang.String NEXT
        Indicates that the link's context is a part of a series, and that the next in the series is the link target.

      • PINGBACK

        Gives the address of the pingback resource for the link context.
        See Also:
        http://www.hixie.ch/specs/pingback/pingback , Constant Field Values

      • PRECONNECT

        public static final java.lang.String PRECONNECT
        Used to indicate an origin that will be used to fetch required resources for the link context. Initiating an early connection, which includes the DNS lookup, TCP handshake, and optional TLS negotiation, allows the user agent to mask the high latency costs of establishing a connection.
        See Also:
        https://www.w3.org/TR/resource-hints/ , Constant Field Values

      • PREDECESSOR_VERSION

        public static final java.lang.String PREDECESSOR_VERSION
        Points to a resource containing the predecessor version in the version history.
        See Also:
        RFC5829, Constant Field Values

      • PREFETCH

        public static final java.lang.String PREFETCH
        The prefetch link relation type is used to identify a resource that might be required by the next navigation from the link context, and that the user agent ought to fetch, such that the user agent can deliver a faster response once the resource is requested in the future.
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/resource-hints/, Constant Field Values

      • PRELOAD

        public static final java.lang.String PRELOAD
        Refers to a resource that should be loaded early in the processing of the link's context, without blocking rendering.
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/preload/, Constant Field Values

      • PRERENDER

        public static final java.lang.String PRERENDER
        Used to identify a resource that might be required by the next navigation from the link context, and that the user agent ought to fetch and execute, such that the user agent can deliver a faster response once the resource is requested in the future.
        See Also:
        https://www.w3.org/TR/resource-hints/, Constant Field Values

      • PREV

        public static final java.lang.String PREV
        Indicates that the link's context is a part of a series, and that the previous in the series is the link target.
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/html5/links.html#link-type-prev , Constant Field Values

        public static final java.lang.String PREVIOUS
        Refers to the previous resource in an ordered series of resources. Synonym for "prev".

      • RESTCONF

        public static final java.lang.String RESTCONF
        Identifies the root of RESTCONF API as configured on this HTTP server. The "restconf" relation defines the root of the API defined in RFC8040. Subsequent revisions of RESTCONF will use alternate relation values to support protocol versioning.
        See Also:
        RFC8040, Constant Field Values

      • VIA

        public static final java.lang.String VIA
        Identifies a resource that is the source of the information in the link's context.
        See Also:
        RFC4287, Constant Field Values

      • WEB_MENTION

        public static final java.lang.String WEB_MENTION
        Identifies a target URI that supports the Webmention protcol. This allows clients that mention a resource in some form of publishing process to contact that endpoint and inform it that this resource has been mentioned.
        See Also:
        http://www.w3.org/TR/webmention/, Constant Field Values

      • WORKING_COPY

        public static final java.lang.String WORKING_COPY
        Points to a working copy for this resource.
        See Also:
        RFC5829, Constant Field Values

      • WORKING_COPY_OF

        public static final java.lang.String WORKING_COPY_OF
        Points to the versioned resource from which this working copy was obtained.
        See Also:
        RFC5829, Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Relation

        public Relation(java.lang.String rel)
         throws java.net.URISyntaxException
        Constructs an instance of Relation.
        Parameters:
        rel - The textual representation of the relation.
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException - Thrown if the textual representation of the relation is not a registered relation, and is not a valid URI. All extension relations must be in the form of a URI.

      • Relation

        public Relation(java.net.URI rel)
        Constructs an instance of Relation that is an extension relation.
        Parameters:
        rel - The URI representation of the extension relation.
